categories.name: Configuration
categories.description: Configuration file and environment setup issues

categories.name: Network
categories.description: SSH connectivity and network communication issues

categories.name: Worker
categories.description: Remote worker selection, health, and management issues

categories.name: Build
categories.description: Remote compilation and build process issues

categories.name: Internal
categories.description: Internal errors that may indicate bugs

remediation: Run 'rch init' to create a default configuration
Check if ~/.config/rch/config.toml exists
Set RCH_CONFIG environment variable to specify custom path
Check file permissions on the configuration file
Verify the file is not corrupted
Ensure no other process has locked the file

errors.message: Configuration file contains invalid TOML syntax
remediation: Run 'rch config validate' to identify syntax errors
Check TOML syntax at the indicated line
Ensure all strings are properly quoted
Run 'rch config validate' for detailed diagnostics
Check that all required fields are present
Verify values are within allowed ranges
Check the environment variable value format
Unset the variable to use config file defaults
See 'rch help env' for valid environment variables
List available profiles with 'rch config profiles'
Create the profile in your configuration file
Check for typos in the profile name
Add at least one worker to your configuration
Run 'rch discover' to find available workers
Check the [workers] section in your config
Verify worker hostname is correct
Check SSH username and key configuration
Ensure remote_base_dir is a valid path

errors.message: SSH key path is invalid or inaccessible
remediation: Check that the SSH key file exists
Verify file permissions (should be 600)
Ensure the key format is valid (ssh-keygen -y -f KEY)

errors.message: Socket path is invalid or inaccessible
remediation: Check directory permissions for socket path
Ensure parent directory exists
Try using the default socket path

errors.message: Cargo manifest parse failure during path-dependency resolution
remediation: Check Cargo.toml syntax with 'cargo verify-project'
Ensure all path-dependency Cargo.toml files are valid TOML
Run 'cargo metadata' manually to see detailed parse errors

errors.message: Path dependency declared but target directory not found
remediation: Verify the path in Cargo.toml [dependencies] exists on disk
Check for typos in the dependency path value
Ensure all workspace members are checked out

errors.message: Cyclic path dependency detected in dependency graph
remediation: Review the path dependency graph for cycles
Run 'cargo metadata' to visualize the dependency tree
Break the cycle by restructuring crate boundaries

errors.message: Path dependency violates canonical-root topology policy
remediation: Ensure all path dependencies are under the canonical root (/data/projects)
Check that paths resolve within allowed topology prefixes
Review the PathTopologyPolicy configuration
Verify 'cargo' is installed and on PATH
Check that Cargo.toml is a valid project manifest
Try running 'cargo metadata --format-version=1' manually

errors.message: cargo metadata output could not be parsed
remediation: Run 'cargo metadata --format-version=1' and check JSON output
Ensure cargo version is recent enough for the workspace layout
Check for toolchain incompatibilities with rust-toolchain.toml
Check that all path dependencies are resolvable
Run 'cargo metadata' to verify dependency graph health
Review dependency closure planner logs for specific failures

errors.message: Dependency closure entered fail-open state due to unverifiable data
remediation: Transfer will proceed with project root only (fail-open semantics)
Check path dependency graph health to restore full closure
Review the fail-open reason in structured diagnostics output

errors.message: High-risk path dependencies detected in closure plan
remediation: Review the high-risk dependencies flagged in the plan
Ensure all dependency paths are canonical and stable
Consider pinning dependency versions to reduce risk

errors.message: Required dependency closure data is missing or incomplete
remediation: Ensure Cargo.toml and Cargo.lock are present and valid
Check that all workspace members are accessible
Run 'cargo update' to regenerate lock file if needed

errors.message: Closure sync action ordering is non-deterministic
remediation: Report this as a bug — closure ordering must be deterministic
Check for filesystem race conditions or concurrent modifications
Retry the operation to see if the ordering stabilizes
A dependency manifest changed since the plan was computed
Recompute the closure plan to pick up the latest manifests
Check for concurrent modifications to Cargo.toml files
Verify the worker host is reachable: ping <host>
Check that SSH service is running on the worker
Verify firewall allows SSH (port 22)
Try connecting manually: ssh <user>@<host>
Verify SSH key is in authorized_keys on the worker
Check SSH key passphrase if applicable
Ensure ssh-agent is running with key loaded
Try: ssh-add -l to list loaded keys

errors.message: SSH key not found or has invalid format
remediation: Check that the SSH key file exists at the configured path
Verify key file permissions are 600
Regenerate key if format is corrupted
Accept the host key: ssh <user>@<host> (confirm fingerprint)
Check known_hosts for conflicting entries
Update known_hosts_policy in config if appropriate
Check network connectivity to the worker
Increase timeout in configuration
Verify worker is not overloaded
Check network stability
Verify worker has not rebooted
Look for keepalive settings in SSH config

errors.message: DNS resolution failed for worker host
remediation: Verify worker hostname is correct
Check DNS server configuration
Try using IP address instead of hostname
Check network connection on local machine
Verify VPN connection if required
Check routing to worker network
Verify SSH service is running on worker
Check if worker firewall allows connections
Ensure correct port is being used
Check network latency to worker
Verify worker is responsive
Increase connection timeout in config
Configure at least one worker in config.toml
Run 'rch discover' to find available workers
Check that configured workers are enabled
Run 'rch doctor' to diagnose worker issues
Check individual worker connectivity
Review worker health check logs
Verify SSH connectivity to worker
Check worker disk space and load
Review health check timeout settings
Run 'rch self-test --worker <name>' for details
Verify Rust toolchain on worker
Check worker has required dependencies
Wait for current builds to complete
Add more workers to distribute load
Increase max_concurrent_builds on worker
Install required toolchain on worker
Run 'rustup show' on worker to verify
Update worker toolchain configuration
Restart the RCH daemon: rchd restart
Check for stale lock files
Review daemon logs for details
Wait for circuit breaker reset period
Check worker health manually
Review recent build failures on worker
Verify at least one worker is healthy
Check selection strategy configuration
Review worker weights and priorities
Verify SSH connectivity to worker
Check that load query command works on worker
Review timeout settings for load queries

errors.message: Worker disk usage is critically high
remediation: Clean up old builds: rch cache clean --worker <id>
Check disk usage: df -h on worker
Remove unused toolchains or build artifacts

errors.message: Worker disk usage exceeded warning threshold
remediation: Monitor disk usage trend for further degradation
Schedule proactive cleanup of old build artifacts
Review disk pressure thresholds in daemon configuration

errors.message: Worker disk telemetry is stale or missing
remediation: Check worker health: rch workers probe <id>
Verify SSH connectivity to the worker
Review telemetry polling interval in daemon configuration

errors.message: Worker disk I/O utilization is too high
remediation: Wait for I/O-heavy operations to complete
Check for concurrent builds saturating disk bandwidth
Review I/O scheduling and worker slot limits
Review worker slot count — fewer concurrent builds reduces memory pressure
Check for memory leaks in long-running builds
Increase worker memory or reduce max_concurrent_builds

errors.message: Disk reclaim operation failed on worker
remediation: Check worker filesystem health
Verify permissions on build artifact directories
Review reclaim policy configuration in daemon settings
Try a different worker with more available headroom
Clean up build artifacts: rch cache clean --worker <id>
Review headroom requirements for the current build profile

errors.message: Active build protection prevented disk reclaim
remediation: Wait for in-progress builds to complete before reclaiming
Review active build list with rch status
Consider cancelling lower-priority builds if disk is critical
Review compilation errors in output
Verify code compiles locally first
Check for missing dependencies on worker
Check that the command is supported
Verify cargo/rustc version compatibility
Review RCH command pattern configuration

errors.message: Build process was killed by signal
remediation: Check worker system logs for OOM killer
Review build memory requirements
Check if build was manually interrupted
Increase build timeout in configuration
Check for infinite loops or hangs
Verify worker is not overloaded
Check worker disk space
Verify PTY allocation settings
Review output buffer configuration
Verify remote_base_dir is writable
Check directory permissions on worker
Ensure path does not contain special characters
Verify toolchain is installed on worker
Check rustup default toolchain
Review toolchain override settings
Check environment variable configuration
Verify required environment is set on worker
Review shell initialization on worker
Run 'cargo clean' on remote workspace
Delete incremental compilation cache
Try full rebuild with --release
Verify build completed successfully
Check artifact path configuration
Review build output for artifact location
Ensure the process triage adapter binary is installed on the worker
Check adapter path configuration in daemon settings
Verify the adapter process is running: rch workers probe <id>

errors.message: Process detector could not classify with confidence
remediation: Review the process list manually on the worker
Lower the confidence threshold if appropriate
Add process signatures to the detector knowledge base

errors.message: Process triage action violates safe-action policy
remediation: Use a lower-risk action class or request explicit approval
Review the safe-action policy boundaries in configuration
Escalate to operator if the action is genuinely needed

errors.message: Transport error communicating with process triage adapter
remediation: Verify the adapter process is running on the worker
Check IPC socket or pipe connectivity to the adapter
Restart the adapter and retry the operation

errors.message: Process triage executor encountered a runtime error

Verify worker OS compatibility with triage actions
Review executor permissions and capabilities
Increase timeout in ProcessTriageTimeoutPolicy configuration
Check worker load — triage may be slow under heavy I/O
Retry the operation after worker load decreases
Retry failed actions individually
Review which actions succeeded vs. failed in the result
Check adapter logs for root cause of partial failures
Validate the request against the contract schema
Check that all required fields are populated
Review the process triage API contract documentation
